str2: Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 1st Person Plural
str2: From apo and erchomai; to go off, aside or behind, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
From rheo; an utterance, ; by implication, a matter or topic; with a negative naught whatever.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
